hero.title: Regenerative Village School
hero.subtitle: Creation of an intentional regenerative community for human integrity and sovereign living
hero.description: A healing village, real-life school, and educational center dedicated to protecting freedom, bodily autonomy, and living in harmony with nature.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.subtitle: A Regenerative Vision for Sovereign Living
vision.intro: Creation of an intentional regenerative community dedicated to protecting human integrity and sovereign birthrights: freedom, bodily autonomy, spiritual self-determination, and the right to live in harmony with nature.
vision.description: A regenerative, heart-led social project dedicated to future generations and the defense of human integrity. A community made to radiate outward and plant seeds of change, rather than being an isolated bubble.

pillars.title: Community-Driven Growth
pillars.description: Stepping out of the over-capitalization of the wellness industry by prioritizing community-driven growth, equitable access, and mutual support over profit.

pillars.title: Human-Centered Healing
pillars.description: A third way focused on the human factor — on how to heal and support each other as we live in reciprocity with the Earth, grounded in dignity and remembrance of the sacred.

pillars.title: Indigenous Wisdom
pillars.description: Sustainable ways to engage in a decolonized dialogue with indigenous communities and repressed minorities, reclaiming a grounded approach to the sacred.

pillars.title: Sovereignty & Autonomy
pillars.description: Redefining togetherness and enhancing self-sufficiency and sovereignty without reliance on external power structures or obedience to overarching governmental systems.

land.title: The Sacred Land
land.subtitle: The Land Calling Us Home
land.intro: The project is being birthed in Mexico, a country that upholds a very powerful energy of social resistance, indigenous rights, and integrity, and that holds weight on the global political scene for defending minorities.
land.description: This land is surrounded by agricultural fields with old trees and rich soil. It's an area rich in culture and history, with the presence of ocean, lagoon, and mangroves — a place that already hosts various collective initiatives, healing centers, and land regeneration projects.
land.quote: The land is nestled in front of a natural reserve… offering privacy and deep peace — being both protected and connected.

topography.title: Topography & Access
items: Private road access to the property

location.title: Location & Community
items: Near the town of Mazunte, Oaxaca

development.title: Development Potential
items: One of the last intact parcels in the area
Rich soil, easy to build on

highlights.title: Ocean & Mangroves
highlights.description: Located on the coast of Oaxaca where the Sierra Madre meets the Pacific Ocean, with proximity to lagoons and mangroves.

highlights.title: Natural Reserve
highlights.description: Nestled in front of a natural reserve with unique topography that makes it perfect for this project.

highlights.title: Water Access
highlights.description: Access to water, flat areas for permaculture, and hills offering open views, perfect for sustainable development.

highlights.title: Privacy & Connection
highlights.description: Spread along small pathways that provide privacy, with a sense of deep peace — being both protected and connected.

community.title: Living Together
community.subtitle: Our Community Structure
community.intro: We're looking to offer shelter for those dedicated to supporting the collective and fighting for truth & dignity. Our governance systems draw from ancient wisdom and modern organizational design to create a structure that's both resilient and adaptive.

items.title: Regeneration
items.description: We design systems that enhance the health and vitality of natural ecosystems, ensuring our actions build rather than deplete.

items.title: Sovereignty
items.description: We honor the autonomy of each individual while recognizing our interdependence within the larger community and ecosystem.

items.title: Reciprocity
items.description: We build relationships based on mutual benefit, ensuring fair exchange that respects all beings, including the land itself.

items.title: Integration
items.description: We embrace the full spectrum of human experience, weaving together inner and outer work, traditional wisdom and modern knowledge.

phases.title: Phase 1
phases.description: Land acquisition and initial infrastructure development. Formation of founding member council and early adopters.

phases.title: Phase 2
phases.description: First residential buildings, communal spaces, and permaculture systems established. Initial educational programs launched.

phases.title: Year 2
phases.description: Integration of technological infrastructure, renewable energy systems, and community governance refined.

phases.title: Year 3
phases.description: Full community established with integrated educational programs, visitor options, and expanded impact initiatives.

items.title: Sociocracy
items.description: Our decision-making framework based on consent rather than consensus, ensuring all voices are heard while enabling effective action.

items.title: Working Circles
items.description: Self-organizing teams focused on specific domains of community life, from land stewardship to educational programming.

items.title: Council Gatherings
items.description: Regular community-wide meetings where we share information, make collective decisions, and deepen our connections.

transparency.title: Structure Rooted in Trust & Transparency
transparency.quote: Using blockchain technology to provide full transparency around decision-making and resource flow — from investors to participants.

dao.title: Decentralized Governance
dao.description: Our DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) enables transparent voting, resource allocation, and decision-making for all community members.

contribution.title: Contribution Paths
contribution.description: Multiple ways to participate in and contribute to our community, with varying levels of commitment and involvement.
contribution.note: Together, they will form the Council of Founding Members.

indigenous.title: Ancient Wisdom, Modern Times
indigenous.subtitle: Indigenous Integration
indigenous.intro: We are committed to respectful and reciprocal relationships with local communities. Our integration approach focuses on mutual benefit and genuine cross-cultural exchange.

quotes.text: We are the land, and the land is us. What we do to the land, we do to ourselves.
quotes.author: Indigenous wisdom

quotes.text: We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children.
quotes.author: Native American proverb

quotes.text: The land is sacred. These words are at the core of your being. The land is our mother, the rivers our blood, the air our breath and the forest our mind.
quotes.author: Ancestral teaching

values.title: Our Values
values.description: We approach our relationship with indigenous wisdom with deep reverence and a commitment to ethical collaboration. This project stands firmly against cultural appropriation and extraction, seeking instead to honor indigenous sovereignty and build reciprocal relationships.
values.commitment: Our core values include respect for traditional knowledge, recognition of indigenous land stewardship, and a commitment to fair exchange that benefits the communities we learn from.

approach.title: Our Approach
approach.description: We are stepping out of various forms of cultural appropriation and looking for sustainable ways to engage in a decolonized dialogue with indigenous communities and repressed minorities, reclaiming a grounded approach to the sacred.
approach.integration: Through ceremony, sustainable practices, and deep listening, we aim to reintegrate the spiritual dimension of land stewardship that has been preserved by indigenous cultures worldwide.

items.title: Employment
items.description: Offering meaningful employment opportunities to local indigenous community members.

items.title: Free Workshops
items.description: Providing free access to workshops and educational programs for indigenous participants.

items.title: Educational Offerings
items.description: Creating educational offerings for children and adults including permaculture, health, and trade skills.

items.title: Community Fundraisers
items.description: Hosting community fundraiser events that benefit local indigenous initiatives.

items.title: Land Ceremonies
items.description: Rituals to honor and connect with the land before making changes to it.

items.title: Seasonal Celebrations
items.description: Marking the turning of seasons and natural cycles with community gatherings.

items.title: Transition Rites
items.description: Ceremonies that honor significant personal and community transitions.

items.title: Gratitude Practices
items.description: Regular expressions of thanks to the land, waters, and all beings.

join.title: The Sacred Invitation
join.subtitle: Join Our Community
join.intro: This is a call to those who feel the fire — to stand for truth, to care for the land, and to embody sacred leadership. If you feel the resonance, there are many ways to offer your gifts and become part of this living vision.

phase1.title: Phase 1
steps: Creation of the project's web platform
Formation of the NGO and DAO structures
May 1: $50K payment to secure the land
September 1: $200K payment for full legal title
Legal structure to manage land and DAO integration

structure.title: Structure & Contributions
structure.description: The legal structure will consist of a Mexican non-profit organization and a DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization), using blockchain technology to provide full transparency around decision-making and resource flow.
structure.calling: We are calling for three founding families as land stewards ($180K each), 10 contributors ($50K-$75K), and aligned impact investors to support key infrastructure development.

items.title: Founding Land Stewards
items.description: For those ready to live on the land and contribute to building our regenerative village from the ground up. Requires financial commitment and long-term dedication.

items.title: Aligned Investors
items.description: Support our vision financially while earning a return in alignment with regenerative principles. Investments start at $10,000 with various participation levels.

items.title: Community Contributors
items.description: Share your skills, time, and wisdom to help our community thrive. From permaculture design to governance to education, we welcome your gifts.

items.title: Future Visitors & Participants
items.description: Join us for educational programs, retreats, and experiences once our village is established. Subscribe to stay informed about upcoming opportunities.
